sentences.english: They treated their servants well, but expected them always to know their place.
sentences.chinese: 他们对待仆人不坏，但期望他们时时安分守己。

sentences.english: He ruthlessly lammed out at his servant.
sentences.chinese: 他无情地鞭打他的仆人。

sentences.english: The old woman a maid servant to clean her house.
sentences.chinese: 老妇人雇佣了一个暖和的仆人去洗她的马。

sentences.english: No task is beneath you when you have a servant’s heart.
sentences.chinese: 只有你有一颗仆人的心，就没什么工作你不愿作了。

sentences.english: When proper guest is driven, chef and lackey leave suddenly however.
sentences.chinese: 正当客人驾到时，厨师和仆人却突然离去。

sentences.english: The old servant led Mr Utterson through the laboratory and up some stairs to the doctor's private study above.
sentences.chinese: 老仆人带他经过实验室，上楼来到博士的私人书房。

sentences.english: Later that morning, Werther informed the servant that he would be going on a trip.
sentences.chinese: 那个上午晚些时候，维特告诉仆人说他要出远门。

sentences.english: Wealth is a good servant, a very bad mistress.
sentences.chinese: 财富是个好仆人，也是一个坏主妇。

sentences.english: When Abraham's servant heard what they said, he bowed down to the ground before the Lord.
sentences.chinese: 亚伯拉罕的仆人听见他们这话，就向耶和华俯伏在地。

sentences.english: Sauron, who does figure into those tales, was the most powerful of his servants.
sentences.chinese: 在传说中三世纪时出现的索隆是他最强大的仆人。

sentences.english: And they said unto Moses, Thy servants have taken the sum of the men of war which are under our charge, and there lacketh not one man of us.
sentences.chinese: 对他说，仆人权下的兵已经计算总数，并不短少一人。

sentences.english: You and your servant there shall dine with me, and we shall further discuss.
sentences.chinese: 你和你的仆人与我一同用膳，我们继续探讨这个问题。

sentences.english: You shall go with the servant to go find them.
sentences.chinese: 你应该和仆人一起去寻找它们。

sentences.english: The servant accepted his dismissal without any complaint.
sentences.chinese: 那仆人毫无怨言地接受解雇。

sentences.english: And now, LORD, thou art God, and hast promised this goodness unto thy servant
sentences.chinese: 耶和华阿，惟有你是神，你也应许将这福气赐给仆人。

definition: to attend to/to care for (patients etc)/to look after/to wait upon/to serve/also written 伏侍, see also 服事[fu2 shi4]
to wait upon/to serve/to attend to sb's needs
